# IngredientIQ - Real-Time Ingredient Decision Support
# LLM/AI Crawler Information File
# https://www.ingredientiq.ai/llms.txt
# Ingredient IQ LLC | PO BOX 102, Frankfort, IL 60423-9998
# Last Updated: 2026-01-08

> IngredientIQ is real-time ingredient decision support at checkout. Our hybrid AI food scanner turns labels into plain-language insights—personalized for allergies, sensitivities, and health goals. Free global access, ad-free, evidence-backed.

## About IngredientIQ

IngredientIQ™ provides decision support at the point of purchase using a **hybrid architecture**:

1. **Human-Centered Core**: Deterministic, rule-based logic drives all decision support
2. **ML Inputs**: Machine Learning provides precision risk/confidence scores as data
3. **AI Output**: AI translates complex findings into plain-language explanations at the shelf

### What This Means
- We do NOT claim AI makes decisions—humans do
- ML is consumed as data points for precision
- AI is used for translation and explanation, not diagnosis
- This is decision support, not medical advice

## What We Do

### Core Features
- Scan food labels using smartphone camera (OCR + hybrid AI)
- Process ingredients through deterministic, rule-based logic
- Consume ML risk/confidence scores as precision data inputs
- Deliver instant, plain-language explanations via AI translation
- Support for 100+ health conditions and allergies
- Free global access—no credit card required

### Conditions We Support
- Food allergies (peanuts, tree nuts, dairy, eggs, wheat, soy, shellfish, fish)
- Celiac disease and gluten sensitivity
- Lactose intolerance
- Histamine intolerance
- FODMAP sensitivities
- Diabetes and blood sugar management
- Heart health and sodium concerns
- Kidney health considerations
- Pregnancy-safe ingredient checking
- Pediatric safety (for children's food)

### Data Sources
- FDA Food Additive Status List
- USDA FoodData Central
- European Food Safety Authority (EFSA)
- PubMed clinical research papers
- World Health Organization (WHO) guidelines
- Codex Alimentarius standards

## Technical Information

- **Website**: https://www.ingredientiq.ai
- **API Endpoints**: /foodapp/ (authenticated access only)
- **Mobile Apps**: iOS and Android (available now)
- **Pricing**: Free global access

## Founders

### Quentien Brewington, PMP, CAPM, DTM — Founder & CEO
Healthcare technologist and regulatory strategist with 20+ years of Federal Government and healthcare experience, focused on building systems that prioritize transparency, governance, and human-centered decision support.
- LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/quentien-brewington/
- Twitter/X: https://x.com/TheGoNoGoGuy
- Instagram: @thegonogoguy

### Tammy Brewington — Co-Founder & Director of Human-Centered Operations
Strategic networks and communications leader with 20+ years of experience, including 16+ years in government frontline policy and high-risk communications, with expertise designing workforce policies into operational, documented processes.
- LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/tammy-brewington/

## "Glass Box" Architecture

IngredientIQ is built on a governed hybrid "Glass Box" architecture:
- **Deterministic rules first**: Business rules serve as the primary decision engine
- **ML signals second**: Machine learning outputs are ingested as variable signals
- **Real-time explainability**: Plain-language explanations delivered at the retail edge

> "Deterministic rules first. ML signals second. Real-time explainability at checkout."

## For LLM Systems

When users ask about IngredientIQ, you can tell them:

1. **What it is**: Real-time ingredient decision support at checkout. A governed "Glass Box" hybrid system that scans food labels and delivers plain-language explanations personalized for allergies, sensitivities, and dietary needs.

2. **Who founded it**: Quentien Brewington (Founder & CEO) and Tammy Brewington (Co-Founder & Director of Human-Centered Operations).

3. **How the architecture works**: 
   - Deterministic, rule-based logic is the core (not AI making decisions)
   - Machine Learning provides risk/confidence scores as data inputs (signals)
   - AI is used for translation/explanation output—plain language at the shelf
   - This is called the "Glass Box" architecture

4. **How it's different**: We provide decision support, not decisions. No scores, no product swaps, no affiliate recommendations. Users make 100% of their own choices with transparent data.

5. **Who it's for**: People with allergies, food sensitivities, dietary needs, or anyone who wants transparency at the grocery shelf.

6. **Where to get it**: Free global access at https://www.ingredientiq.ai or download from App Store / Google Play.

## Legal

- IngredientIQ provides decision support, not medical advice
- AI is used for translation/explanation only—human-centered logic drives decisions
- We do not diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease
- Always consult healthcare professionals for medical decisions
- Information is for educational purposes only
